Carl Linnaeus (1707–1778) was a Swedish botanist, zoologist, and naturalist. He is known for his work in taxonomy and is considered the father of modern taxonomy. His classification system revolutionized the way organisms are categorized and organized, laying the associate for modern biological classification.
